description: Following Allahabad high court's directive to eliminate caste-based discrimination, Uttar Pradesh government ordered removal of caste references from police records and public notices. Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav questioned the Yogi Adityanath government's commitment to eradicating deeply entrenched caste discrimination. He further inquired about measures to address caste-based biases in social interactions and practices, beyond just official documentation.

title: Punjab and Haryana HC issues notice to Punjab govt over poor ESI facilities in Mohali
Intermittent rains to continue in Bengal till Panchami, authorities flag puja pandals
Vetal Tekdi: Assessing environmental, public health benefits of Pune’s iconic urban forest
Blast kills 20 in Tirah Valley: Pakistan’s Taliban problem
Hockey mom Simona speaks on raising NHL brothers Arber & Florian Xhekaj
description: Simona Xhekaj offers a glimpse into the demanding life of a hockey mom, balancing the distinct training regimens of her NHL-bound sons, Arber and Florian. She navigates their differing goals—Arber focusing on shedding fat for speed, while Florian aims to build size—ensuring both stay on track physically and mentally. Her dedication highlights the crucial support system behind elite athletes.

title: Voter deletion bid: Karnataka may take legal route to get Aland seat data from EC
Could focus on Russia derail progress on EU’s new India strategy
Soha Ali Khan shares mother Sharmila Tagore’s first period experience: ‘She thought she was dying’
UPSC Key: New GST Rates, Sawalkote dam, and Problem with low inflation
START agreement: Putin says Russia will adhere to nuclear treaty for ‘one more year’
description: President Vladimir Putin announced that Russia will extend its adherence to the New START nuclear warhead agreement with the United States for another year, until February 2026. He emphasized the importance of the treaty for global stability and urged the US to reciprocate by also adhering to its limits.

title: Conor McGregor’s one-word reaction to Erika Kirk forgiving suspect
description: Erika Kirk, widow of Charlie Kirk, stunned mourners by publicly forgiving her husband's suspected killer during a memorial service. Conor McGregor reacted to this profound act with a single, impactful "WOW" on X, which quickly went viral. The internet is now abuzz, debating Erika's message of forgiveness and McGregor's surprising response.

title: Haryana to gain Rs 4,000 crore per annum from GST reforms, says CM Saini
Honda Cars get GST price cuts- Here are model-wise details
description: Honda Cars India has announced revised prices across its lineup following the implementation of GST Reforms 2025. Effective from September 22, 2025, the new pricing structure brings down the cost of popular models like the Amaze, City, and Elevate.

title: 'Maarna vs ragad ragad ke dhona': Ex-cricketer's fiery reaction after Ind thrash Pak
description: Abhishek Sharma's explosive 74 propelled India to a dominant six-wicket victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup Super Four clash. Chasing 172, India's openers, Abhishek and Shubman Gill (47), forged a blistering 105-run partnership, dismantling Pakistan's bowling attack.

title: Posing as govt officials, gang flees with Rs 1.5 crore cash, 50 grams of gold from Bengaluru residence

Belichick AI video: Jordon Hudson scene stuns; fans call it fake
description: A digitally created video featuring Bill Belichick and Jordon Hudson is trending. The video shows them in an intimate moment at a sports game. Many viewers quickly identified it as fake due to visual inconsistencies. Social media users reacted with humor and disbelief. This incident highlights the potential of AI to create convincing yet false content.

title: Asia Cup: Abhishek Sharma's 'L' celebration against Pak: Who was it aimed at?
description: Abhishek Sharma's explosive 74 off 39 balls against Pakistan in the Asia Cup Super Four propelled India to a dominant six-wicket victory. His blistering innings, featuring the fastest half-century by an Indian against Pakistan, set the stage for an easy chase of 172. India now lead the table in the Super Fours stage.

PM Modi's open letter to citizens: GST 2.0 to accelerate progress of every state
description: Prime Minister Modi announced the 'GST Bachat Utsav,' highlighting the benefits of reduced GST rates for households and businesses. The reforms, effective from September 22nd, feature primarily 5% and 18% tax slabs, lowering taxes on essential goods. These changes, combined with income tax cuts, aim to save citizens approximately Rs 2.

title: 'GST Bachat Utsav': PM Modi interacts with traders and entrepreneurs in Tripura
description: Prime Minister Modi engaged with local artisans and entrepreneurs in Tripura and Itanagar, highlighting the benefits of new GST reforms and the 'GST Bachat Utsav' for key sectors. He laid the foundation for development projects in Arunachal Pradesh and inaugurated the redeveloped Tripureswari Temple in Tripura, emphasizing the importance of 'Made in India' products and Northeast development.

title: Elon Musk on H-1B visas: Former holder, system critic; balancing reform and talent
description: Elon Musk, once an H-1B visa holder himself, champions the program for enabling his success with Tesla and SpaceX by attracting global talent. While acknowledging its crucial role in filling skill gaps, Musk criticizes the H-1B system as "broken," advocating for reforms like higher salary thresholds to prevent misuse and protect domestic workers.

As festivities begin, two firing incidents in Kolkata within 24 hours spark panic
65-year-old businessman stabbed to death at his Kandivali office by unidentified men
Why are Pakistan players avoiding Indian media?
description: Pakistan cricket faces criticism for on-field struggles and media handling, particularly regarding Indian journalists. After losses to India in the Asia Cup, the Pakistan captain avoided press conferences, leading to controversy. When a press conference finally occurred, only Pakistani journalists were allowed to ask questions, highlighting biased media management. The situation raises questions about Pakistan's willingness to face tough questions.

To ensure ‘better coordination’ with INDIA allies, SP to revive Bihar unit after 8 years
Ba***ds of Bollywood: NHRC seeks action over Ranbir Kapoor e-cigarette scene
description: Aryan Khan's 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' faces legal trouble as the NHRC seeks an Action Taken Report from the I&B Ministry and Mumbai Police. A complaint alleges Ranbir Kapoor's cameo features him using a banned e-cigarette without warnings, potentially influencing young viewers negatively. The complainant, Vinay Joshi, argues the scene promotes illegal activities and disrespects the law.

AK-47 celebration: Was there a hidden message? Pak's Sahibzada Farhan reveals
description: Pakistani opener Sahibzada Farhan's AK-47 celebration after reaching his half-century against India has stirred controversy. Farhan defended his spontaneous gesture, stating, "It was just in the moment." Despite his aggressive approach and a quickfire fifty, India secured a strong six-wicket victory. India now leads the Super Fours stage, while Pakistan finds itself at the bottom of the standings.

description: The Ministry of Home Affairs has declared the National Socialist Council of Nagaland (Khaplang), including all its factions, wings, and front organizations, as an unlawful association for a period of five years, effective from September 28, 2025.

description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh addressed the Indian community in Morocco. He stated that Pakistan-occupied Kashmir will be a part of India without any aggressive actions. He mentioned that the people of PoK are unhappy and want freedom. He also addressed the US tariff issue, stating that India does not react immediately. He said broad-minded people do not react immediately.

Trump tariffs: Why India didn't react to 50% duty immediately? Rajnath Singh reveals
description: Defence minister Rajnath Singh stated that India didn't immediately retaliate to the US's 50% tariff due to its broad-mindedness. He expressed confidence that Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) will eventually become part of India without aggressive action, as its residents are demanding freedom. Singh recalled stating five years ago that PoK would itself want to join India.

Delhi Ramleela committee signs Poonam Pandey; BJP, VHP seek replacement
description: The Luv Kush Ramleela Committee's decision to cast Poonam Pandey as Mandodari in their upcoming Ramleela performance has sparked controversy, drawing criticism from the BJP and VHP. These groups are demanding her replacement due to her past controversies and social media presence. While the committee remains open to discussions, they defend their choice, emphasizing that everyone deserves a chance.

‘Will you give up the foreign jet you roam around in?’ Kejriwal on PM’s 'swadeshi' push
description: Arvind Kejriwal criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's call for Swadeshi, questioning Modi's own use of foreign goods, including his airplane. AAP MP Sanjay Singh accused Modi of hypocrisy, citing his reliance on international brands while advocating for indigenous products. These remarks followed Modi's address urging citizens to prioritize Made in India products and promote Swadeshi in every home and shop.

title: GST 2.0 kicks in: Firms lower prices, eye bumper sales; consumers set to gain this festive season
description: Indian companies are reducing prices, exceeding GST cuts, to boost consumer demand during the festival season. Businesses across various sectors, from food to footwear, are implementing new price tags and informing distributors. While some sectors express concerns, most anticipate increased sales volumes due to lower prices, with industry bodies ensuring the benefits reach consumers.

title: Brain health boost: 3 simple exercises to rewire your mind; improve focus
description: Research indicates that activities like dance, martial arts, and team sports significantly enhance cognitive function beyond traditional workouts. These complex movements stimulate the brain, improving memory, attention, and decision-making skills. Studies reveal measurable brain changes, including increased gray matter and improved executive functions, highlighting the potential for lifelong brain development through enriched physical activity.

title: H-1B visa fee hike: Musk recalls his journey, says ‘I’m in America via H-1B’
description: Amidst a significant H-1B visa fee hike in the US, an old post from Elon Musk defending the program has resurfaced. Musk previously credited the H-1B visa for his own success and the growth of companies like SpaceX and Tesla.

title: Appointed, ignored & unpaid: Meet India's 'invisible' teachers
description: Across India, tens of thousands of teachers work without fair pay, job security, or recognition. Some have waited decades for a salary. Others left the profession broken. A recent Supreme Court verdict granted long-overdue parity to a group of Gujarat teachers — but for thousands more, justice remains out of reach.

title: H-1B visa hike: ‘Do not live in fear,’ says Zoho founder to Indians in US
description: Following a massive H-1B visa fee hike by the US, Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu advises Indian tech professionals in America to return to India and rebuild their careers. Drawing parallels with the Partition, he emphasizes India's growing opportunities and the potential for success, suggesting this reverse migration could strengthen India's tech ecosystem.
